title: What strategy are you using to improve customer experience for your brands and business? - Quora

response.answer_text: UX design of an app affects a user’s perception and how they interact with that app significantly. App businesses that invest in understanding the behavioural patterns and psychological underpinnings of their target user segment succeed in building app products that exceed user expectations. Leveraging app analytics to discover how customers are using an app would be the best strategy. UserExperior is an easy to use app analytics tool which provides crucial insights into the user journey on your mobile apps. Its really cost-efficient too. The tool features high-quality session replays and touch heatmaps which let you see how your users navigate in your app, how they use, and what they do on your app in a non-intrusive way. UE also uncover the non-responsive areas on your mobile. It keeps a record of the detailed user flow is beneficial for different reasons. First, it helps to track user journeys of different app users to reach the ultimate goal. Secondly, what it also educates about the users drop out without even without completing the purchase. You get to know the following from the user journey analysis: i. User Flow - You can see how the actual app users navigate through your app on a real-time basis as well as replay the user sessions. ii. Broken Journeys - See where the users had poor or broken experience and understand what made them drop out without completing the intended action. iii. Identify the nonresponsive areas - The intuitive dashboard gives you a complete gesture distribution which helps you in understanding where the user is spending most of his time and what parts of the app are ignored the most. UserExperior is one of the best tools in the market to understand the user journeys and it is also the most simple across all the SDKs available in the session replay category.
